definition: to go and return/to return/to resume/to return to a normal or original state/to repeat/again/to recover/to restore/to turn over/to reply/to answer/to reply to a letter/to retaliate/to carry out
variant of 復|复[fu4]/to reply to a letter
letter/mail/CL:封[feng1]/to trust/to believe/to profess faith in/truthful/confidence/trust/at will/at random

sentences.english: He finally rummaged out her reply in the middle drawer of his desk.
sentences.chinese: 他最后从写字台中间抽屉里翻找出她的复信。

sentences.english: I wrote to them last month and I'm still waiting for a reply.
sentences.chinese: 我上个月给他们写了信，迄今还在等复信。

sentences.english: Please feel free to respond in Chinese or English.
sentences.chinese: 无论你用中文或英文复信给我都没有问题。

sentences.english: She answered his letter in such wise that she seemed more of less betwixt and between.
sentences.chinese: 她给他的复信写的多少似乎带有摸棱两可的笔调。

sentences.english: I didn't receive an acknowledgement of my application.
sentences.chinese: 对我的申请，我还没有收到复信告知收悉。

sentences.english: I have much business that has hindered my answering your letter .
sentences.chinese: 我有很多事使我不能早日给你复信。

sentences.english: If you can reply soon , we would be appreciated.
sentences.chinese: 如蒙早日复信，不胜感谢。

sentences.english: I did not reply because your letter never reached me.
sentences.chinese: 我没有复信，因为你的信从未到我手里。

sentences.english: This offer is subject to the goods being unsold on receipt of your reply.
sentences.chinese: 本盘以收到贵方复信时尚未出售为条件。

sentences.english: Mike: I put an ad in the newspaper, but I haven't got many replies so far.
sentences.chinese: 我已经在报纸上登了广告，不过目前仍不多少复信。

sentences.english: His hopes of marrying her were paid to by her reply to his letter.
sentences.chinese: 她给他的复信使他同她结婚的希望一笔勾销。

sentences.english: Mrs. Jones often neglected to answer the letter right away.
sentences.chinese: 琼斯夫人常常忘记马上复信。

definition: incoming letter/letter from afar/same as 来信
(honorific) revered news/the most valuable information (in your recent letter, book etc)/Thank you for your letter.
to reply to a telegram/to wire back
Zhang Shizhao (1881-1973), revolutionary journalist in Shanghai, then established writer
Hu Shi (1891-1962), original proponent of writing in colloquial Chinese 白話文|白话文[bai2 hua4 wen2]
